result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bridget M Borland

records.addlTxt: 11:52 AM This case is being called for a bail/bond hearing. Defendant Bridget M Borland in court, in custody.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Bridget M Borland. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Atty Nimmer presents argument and is requesting a signature bond or huber bailee status for the defendant. Ms. Kane presents argument and advises that the State is objecting to any modification of the bail. Atty Nimmer presents additional statements. For reasons placed on the record, Court will deny the Motion to Modify Bail.  Bail to remain as previously set. Court will maintain the previously scheduled hearing on 11/21/22 at 1:30.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bond filed by Attorney Amanda Nimmer
Filed by the State correcting the case number the charge is relating from.
of the Protective Order on the defendant filed by Waukesha Co. Sheriff.

records.addlTxt: Appointing Atty. Nimmer as counsel of record for the defendant.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key. Signed by Judge Paul F. Reilly on 9/26/22.

Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victim A listed in the Victim Identification Key.  Court further orders the protective order to be sealed. 
The original document was titled: Proposed Protective Order
The original history event date is: 09-22-2022

The original document was titled: Proposed Protective Order
The original history event date is: 09-22-2022

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to initiate any third party contact with victim A.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release. Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 0.5 mile of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent. Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victim A listed in the Victim Identification Key.  Court further orders the protective order to be sealed.

3:15 PM Defendant Bridget M Borland in court, in custody. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. State Public Defender's Office Law Intern appeared for the defense by Patrick Sicula.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  State requests complaint be amended to case# 22 CV 1087.  Court grants amendment. State will file an amended complaint.
Hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
